description: Tendency toward negative emotions and mood swings
gender_tendency: women on average score higher in neuroticism across many cultures .
women generally exhibit greater expressivity (e.g., crying frequency) .

description: Ability to understand and share others’ feelings
gender_tendency: women often score higher on measures of empathy and emotion recognition .
research indicates higher responsiveness in women on average .
more prevalent among women in internalizing disorders research .
women have higher prevalence of depression-related traits .
men may show more overt anger, women may express indirectly, though overall frequency of experienced anger may be similar .
women often report greater fear responses in various contexts .

description: Ability to perceive, use, understand, and manage emotions
gender_tendency: women tend to have slight advantage in certain EI facets like emotion recognition .
women typically score higher on warmth/tender-mindedness facets .

description: Degree to which social exclusion affects mood
gender_tendency: some evidence suggests women may report greater sensitivity .
gender differences are context-specific, but women may use more rumination, men more suppression on average .
women often report higher guilt proneness in social contexts .
somewhat higher in women in certain studies, though context matters .
mixed evidence, but some studies show women report loneliness more, partly due to socialization expectations .

description: Ability to recover from emotional setbacks
gender_tendency: small differences vary by culture and context, with unclear consistent gender trend .
women on average ruminate more, linked to higher depression/anxiety .

description: Women often show higher empathic concern, though also higher personal distress in response to others’ suffering .
Intensity of reaction to emotional stimuli
gender_tendency: women often report more intense affective experiences .

description: While individual variation dominates, some surveys find women slightly more prone to anxious attachment, men to avoidant attachment on average .

gender_tendency: mixed gender findings on facets: women higher on openness to feelings, men higher on openness to ideas .
small or no consistent gender difference in general analytical ability tests when controlling for education .
women often have slight advantage in verbal fluency and reading comprehension on average .

description: Skill in mental rotation and spatial reasoning
gender_tendency: men typically score higher on average in spatial tasks .
overall small gender gap, with context and culture affecting differences; meta-analyses show narrowing gaps over time .
women often perceive higher risk levels than men .

description: Ability to infer others’ mental states
gender_tendency: women tend to perform slightly better on some ToM tasks .

description: Tendency to analyze systems vs. empathic processing
gender_tendency: men often higher systemizing, women higher empathizing on average, though overlap is large .

description: Women often excel in verbal memory tasks
gender_tendency: men sometimes excel in spatial memory tasks .
some studies find women more attentive to detail in social contexts, while men may focus on detail in spatial contexts .
popular belief favors women, but empirical evidence is mixed with no large consistent gap .

description: Divergent thinking and novel idea generation
gender_tendency: little consistent gender difference when controlling for domain and background .
evidence is mixed and context-dependent with no robust gender difference .
some evidence women rely more on intuitive/social cues, men more on analytical logic, though this is context-specific .
few robust gender findings, with variation by domain .
men generally more risk-taking in financial and recreational domains .

description: Ability to wait for larger rewards
gender_tendency: women often exhibit greater delay tolerance on average .

description: Tendency toward positive vs. negative expectations
gender_tendency: mixed findings, but some studies suggest women report slightly lower optimism in financial domains .
small or no consistent gender difference, though context matters .
largely individual, with no strong average gender gap when controlling for education and context .
women on average score higher in agreeableness .
men often score higher in assertiveness facets of extraversion .
women tend to report higher altruistic behaviors in social contexts .
women often excel in reading nonverbal signals .
men may prefer more direct styles, women more collaborative/indirect on average .

description: Tendency toward authoritative vs. participative leadership
gender_tendency: women often favor transformational/participative approaches, men more transactional/assertive, on average .

description: Preference for collaborative vs. competitive interactions
gender_tendency: women may lean more toward cooperation, men more toward competition on average .

description: Willingness to engage in socially uncertain actions
gender_tendency: studies show mixed gender patterns in social risk, sometimes women more averse .
research shows small or context-dependent gender differences, with women sometimes more trusting in social contexts .
women often prefer more collaborative resolution, men may choose direct confrontation or avoidance depending on context .
women often report higher frequencies of prosocial acts .
women more likely to seek emotional support, men less so on average .
some evidence women may have more difficulty asserting boundaries in certain contexts, though data are mixed .
women often employ empathic communication more readily .

description: Tendency to adhere to group norms
gender_tendency: mixed evidence, context dependent; some studies show women conform more in certain settings .

description: Degree to which peers sway behavior
gender_tendency: small or context-dependent differences, with variation by age and culture .

description: Foundation of trust based on early attachments
gender_tendency: individual variation dominates, with minimal consistent gender gap .
women often report higher social anxiety prevalence .
mixed findings, with some evidence women value deeper connections, men broader networks, though cultural factors play a large role .
men may use more direct tactics, women more relational tactics on average .
minimal consistent gender difference when controlling for opportunity and context .
individual variation is large; some surveys find men report higher ambition in career contexts, but context and culture heavily moderate .
men often score higher in competitive orientation on average .
little consistent gender difference when controlling for background .
men generally more motivated for risky endeavors .

description: Desire to explore novel environments or ideas
gender_tendency: tied to openness facets; mixed gender trends depending on domain .
small or no consistent gender gap, though some evidence women are more curious about social/emotional topics .

description: Preference for internal satisfaction vs. external rewards
gender_tendency: context-specific, with no robust gender difference .

description: Preference to master skills vs. demonstrate competence
gender_tendency: mixed evidence with context and socialization influences; no clear universal gender gap .
women often exhibit stronger future planning in some life domains (e.g., health, saving) .
men often higher on present-oriented risk-taking behaviors .

description: Preference for smaller-sooner vs. larger-later rewards
gender_tendency: men tend to discount future rewards more steeply .

description: Belief in one’s ability to execute tasks
gender_tendency: domain-specific differences exist, but overall no large universal gender gap when opportunities and social expectations are equal .
men often report slightly higher self-esteem in adolescence and adulthood, though context and culture moderate .
mixed findings, with no robust gender difference when controlling for socioeconomic factors .
men sometimes show higher optimism bias in risk-taking contexts, women more cautious .
women may report higher need for social approval in certain cultural contexts .
little consistent gender gap after accounting for socialization .

description: Tendency toward seeking gains (promotion) vs. avoiding losses (prevention)
gender_tendency: women sometimes lean more prevention-focused, men promotion-focused in financial decisions .

description: Capacity to maintain motivation after setbacks
gender_tendency: individual variability is high; no clear average gender difference .

description: Propensity to engage in aggressive behavior
gender_tendency: men on average more overtly aggressive, women may show indirect aggression .

description: Desire for varied, novel, and intense experiences
gender_tendency: men score higher across cultures .
men often higher impulsivity, though domain-specific patterns exist .

description: Likelihood to engage in substance use
gender_tendency: men have higher rates of externalizing behaviors like substance use disorders .
men more likely to engage in dangerous driving behaviors .

description: Preferences for types of tech engagement
gender_tendency: mixed findings, with younger women sometimes more social-media oriented, men more gaming/tech gadget oriented on average .
little consistent gender difference when controlling for job demands and culture .
women often report slightly higher self-control in delaying gratification tasks .
women more likely to seek medical care and adhere to healthy behaviors .

description: Propensity for unprotected or casual sex
gender_tendency: men on average report higher frequency of risky sexual behaviors .
women often take on more caregiving roles due to both social and biological factors .
women often post more personal content and seek social feedback, men post more informational or status-oriented updates on average .

description: Likelihood to step into leadership roles
gender_tendency: mixed evidence, with social context playing a large role; small average differences favor men in self-promoted leadership in some cultures .
men often adopt more competitive bargaining strategies, women more collaborative strategies on average .
men more risk-taking in investments, women more risk-averse on average .
women often volunteer more in caregiving or community roles, men more in skill-based or leadership volunteering on average .
men more likely to engage in high-intensity sports, women more likely in group fitness or moderate exercise on average .
women often allocate more time to social and family activities, men more to leisure or solo activities on average, though culture heavily influences .

description: Likelihood to seek professional or social help when facing problems
gender_tendency: women more likely to seek support, men less likely on average .

description: Engagement in activities with environmental hazards (e.g., extreme sports)
gender_tendency: men more likely to engage in high-hazard leisure activities on average .
